intro: Haplostephium passerina, commonly known as the common bird's-beak, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant produces small, oval fruits that are typically dispersed by wind. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open habitats such as coastal dunes or disturbed areas. Haplostephium passerina is native to Europe and parts of western Asia.
